page.title: 19CHANGES SINCE WW2
page.content: Mrs.Dale's family has lived in Tattingstone for many generations. She is the school secretary and helps run th sports clubs. She has seen many changes in the village since the war. Although the size of the village has not changed very much, people seem richer, the roads are busier and there are fewer children. One of the biggest single changes was the flooding of the Alton alley to make the Alton water reservoir. There were no council houses here before the war. Now there are council dwellings in Green Lane, Lemons Hill and Glebe Close. The new houses being built are much bigger. There used to be four shops in Tattingstone, including a saddlers and a blacksmiths. Now there is only a general stores and post office.
